summary: The federal government spends about $8 billion yearly to operate, maintain, and lease office space. The pandemic changed how often employees use this office space, as many employees now work away from the office. In response, GSA launched a federal coworking pilot where agencies share office space and services in six buildings across the country. GSA identified and included many agencies' coworking needs—such as private...
title: Federal Real Property: Actions Needed to Better Assess Office Sharing Pilot's Broader Applicability
